sub_title:
Master student Food Technology 
Dairy Science and Technology 
Product Design and Ingredient Functionality
summary:
Hello, my name is Mark. I graduated from Wageningen University in September 2022 with a Master in Food Technology where I double-specialized myself in Dairy Science and Technology & Food Ingredient Functionality. For this, I had to follow two theses. 
My first Master's thesis was with the Food physics department (FPH). For this thesis, I researched the effect of fat and sugar concentration on a quark-based dessert. Fat and sugar are ingredients that often come up when talking about unhealthy food. We often add them to make a product taste right (sweet and creamy), but it also determines the physical behaviour of the product, for example how thick (viscous) it is. My thesis gives more insight into how fat and sugar influence these properties.
My second thesis was with the Food Chemistry department (FCH). For this thesis, I developed an internal standard for Gas chromatography - mass spectrometry (GC-MS) so that volatiles that develops during fat oxidation can be determined very accurately. This gives a clear insight into the quality of fat oxidation-sensitive products.
After this thesis work, I did an internship at Friesland Campina in Wageningen. Here I looked at gelatin replacement in milk products such as mousse and tompouce. During the internship, I adapted the recipe and looked if vegetable alternatives like Pectin, carrageenan, alginate, xanthan gum, gum arabic and fibres can make similar products.
During my Bachelor's in Wageningen, I took a minor in Food of Animal Origin and did a thesis on Food Quality Design. For this thesis, I researched a sustainable form of Active-Packaging. A technique in which the packaging material actively combats microbial spoilage.
Furthermore, I like to keep myself busy with sports, mainly ballroom dancing. Every year I like to participate in the Dutch- & European tournament for dancing students where I reached 6th place in the amateur class in June 2022.
Besides my studies, I also do volunteer work in the form of committee work. I have organized several activities such as a vacation to France and a dance gala, but I also designed a yearbook.

projects.title: Cheese property research
projects.description:
Research to the properties of cheese.
The cheese was tested for a new target product on its properties like stretchability, blister formation, color changes at high temperature, oiling off and more.
These properties were then linked to the type of cheese, mainly the fat content and age of the cheese.
The project tested my dairy technology knowledge gained during the Master Food Technology Dairy Science and Technology. It was a experience to utilize what I learned over the past few years at the WUR

projects.title: milk powder scooping/melkpoeder scheppen
projects.description:
A Small Highschool project carried out in name of Nutricia Danone, located in Cuijk at the time (moved to Haps). The project is executed as the ‘’meesterproef’’(rough translation: master test) for the course Onderzoek en Ontwerpen (research and design), a course in which students work on different projects that companies and institutions in Cuijk, and the surrounded area, give to them.

One person uses more force during scooping than the next, this results in a variation in the amount of milk powder per feeding. Our project showed that this variation is significantly small. So the scooping works well.
The project includes: 
-how big the variation is in amount of milking powder between different people during scooping. (Significantly small)
-different solutions to achieve universal scooping milk powder (was unnecessary, since there is no problem with how scooping is done now).
-the development of a machine that scoops universal (using the milk powder scoops inside the packages). This machine is made manually and a 3D-model replica is made in Blender and printed using a 3D-printer.

De ene persoon zet meer kracht bij het scheppen dan de ander, dit resulteert in een variatie bij de hoeveelheid melkpoeder in een voedbeurt. ons project heeft kunnen vinden dat de variatie tussen the scoopen significant klein is. Bij dit project is: 
-onderzocht hoe groot de variatie is in de hoeveelheid melkpoeder tussen verschillende testpersonen tijdens het scheppen.
-Bedacht op wat voor verschillende manieren universeel geschept kan worden (niet nodig omdat er bijna geen verschil was tussen het normale scheppen).
-Een machine ontwikkeld die universeel schept (met de schepjes in de melkpoederverpakkingen). Deze machine is handmatig gemaakt en daarna is met Blender een 3D-model ontwikkeld en uitgeprint met een 3D-printer.

courses.name: BSc minor Foods of Animal Origin

profile_positions.description:
At Friesland Campina I had been working as R&D employee to make their products even better. Here, I did research on the role of gelatin and the replacement of gelatin in milk products.
I looked at the effects of pectin, carrageenan, alginate, xanthan gum, gum arabic and fiber on the physical properties and sensory characteristics of milk-based desserts.
profile_positions.title: intern

profile_positions.location: Haps, municipality Cuijk, North Brabant, Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
I Tutored 4 tutoring pupils so far. I helped one girl in 4 Pre-university education chemistry and physics who got passing grades on her pre-university education high school exam. 2 others I helped with their math at 3 and 4 Higher General Secondary Education and have been able to eliminate shortages. The last student had some trouble with math, she got some higher grades now.
I also helped some fellow university students with courses in which I have high grades
profile_positions.title: tutor

profile_positions.description:
I worked here approximately for 4 summer holidays. I learned the basics of pastry and bread baking.
I am not a baker anymore, but I still help my father, Henk de Haas, with small production problems. I enjoy applying my study to real processes.
profile_positions.title: baker

profile_positions.description: I am the Public Relations of the 9th and 10th board of WuBDA. As PR I am tasked with maintaining the (social) media of the association, I maintain our website www.wubda.nl and improve the interaction between our members and our association using the social media and website. The website is made using WordPress by my predecessors. I followed a course on WordPress (see my courses) so I can significantly improve our website. Next to those things I also produce promotion material like flyers and posters, but also digital promotional material to show everyone who great the association is.
profile_positions.title: Public Relations

volunteer_experiences.description:
ENGLISH BELOW
Ik ben een jaar lang lid geweest van de Multimediacie van Nicolas Appert. In deze commissie heb ik gewerk aan de Nicolas Appert site. De gebruikte website tool is Wix. in dit jaar hebben we een FAQ toegevoegd, onnodige bestanden verwijderd zo dat de site sneller werkt, nieuwe functies toegevoed and ik en Ruben Schlüter(multimediacie & bestuur) hebben een webshop kunnen starten.

I was a member of Nicolas Appert's Multimediacie for over 1 year. In this committee, I worked on the Nicolas Appert site. The website tool we used was Wix. In this year we added an FAQ tab, cleaned unnecessary parts of the site so it could run faster, added new functions and lastly, me and Ruben Schlüter(multimediacie & Board) were able to set-up a webshop.
For this committee I help organize the integration gala for 4 study associations: Nicolas Appert, Di-Et-Tri, Heeren XVII and Semper Florens.

ENGLISH BELOW
Een groepje nieuwe master studenten kennis laten maken met de studie, en de studie vereniging nicolas appert. Door dit groepje kennen de nieuwe studenten al enkele studiegenoten. Ook leren ze wat de studievereniging allemaal te bieden heeft. Ik organiseerde hierin kleine activiteiten, zoals een lunch, informeerde de studenten over evenenmenten van Nicolas Appert of hiep ze met vragen over het studeren.

Introducing a group of new master students to the study, food technology, and the study association, Nicolas Appert. Because of this group the new students already know some of their fellow students. They also learn what the study association has to offer. I organized small activities, like a lunch meeting, informed them on activities organized by Nicolas Appert or answered study-related questions.

ENGLISH BELOW
WuBDA is een studenten dans vereniging. De Activity committee organiseert elke academische periode (elke 2 maanden) een members dinner, borrel en activiteit, zoals een pubquiz, spellen avond, pizzaparty en meer, voor leden van WuBDA. Ik help bij het voorbereiden van deze evenementen. Ik ben ook administrative bezig geweest de eerste paar maanden, maar sinds november 2019 ben ik voorzitter geworden.

WuBDA is a student dance association. The Activity Committee organizes a member dinner, drink, and activity such as a pub quiz, games evening, pizza party and more, for members of WuBDA every academic period (every 2 months). I help prepare these events. I kept myself busy with administrative activities for the first few months, but since November 2019 I have been chairman for the committee.
